meanings.sent1: The evil sorcerer tried to unsoul the innocent creature.
meanings.sent2: The dark magic attempted to unsoul the enchanted forest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fairy played a prank by pretending to unsoul the talking mirror.
meanings.sent4: The haunting melody seemed to unsoul the old piano in the abandoned mansion.
meanings.sent5: The ancient curse threatened to unsoul the entire village.

meanings.definition: To remove or destroy the soul from something or someone
meanings.sent1: The wicked witch cast a spell to unsoul the cursed amulet.
meanings.sent2: The forbidden ritual was said to unsoul any who dared to perform it.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy wizard accidentally unsouled his own reflection in the magic pond.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious fog seemed to unsoul the very essence of the haunted graveyard.
meanings.sent5: The ominous prophecy foretold a dark force that would unsoul the ancient temple.
